item.title: Venice Theatre stages a musical 'Spelling Bee' for annual SummerStock
item.description: After a two-year hiatus caused by damage from Hurricane Ian in 2023, Venice Theatre has brought back its SummerStock program, which this year will culminate with the Tony Award-winning musical “The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee.”

item.title: Vote: Who is Sarasota-Manatee's all-time best state championship softball team
item.description: The Herald-Tribune has gone back and documented the fast-pitch softball teams that have won state championships.

item.title: MLB Draft: Venice alum Marek Houston picked by Minnesota 16th overall
item.description: Marek Houston went right where he was projected to go by Baseball America.

item.title: 4 dead in Florida from Vibrio vulnificus, here's where
item.description: Eleven people have contracted Vibrio vulnificus, the so-called "fleshing-eating" bacteria, and four of them have died from it so far in 2025, according to theFlorida Department of Health.

item.title: Florida weather forecast this week: Keep that umbrella handy
item.description: Get ready for a wet week across most of Florida as a system of low pressure moves from the Atlantic into the Gulf.

item.title: Florida Lottery Cash4Life, Fantasy 5 results for July 13…

item.title: What should ordinary investors know about 'comparative…
item.description: When we stroll down the aisles of our local supermarket, pause to browse electronics, or flip through streaming services at home, we seldom stop to think about how seamlessly international cultures and products have become part of our daily lives. Globalization – the process of international integration arising from interchange of world views, products, ideas, and cultural nuances – has quietly reshaped how we live, eat, entertain ourselves, and communicate.

item.title: Killing Florida black bears will help them live? Seriously?
item.description: Just a few comments regarding the recent guest column – titled "Managing Bears Now and for the Future" – written by George Warthen, the chief conservation officer for the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC).
